LawComix | awards = | website = | nonUS = | sortkey = Fincher, Charles | subcat = American }} '''Charles Pugsley Fincher''' (born December 30, 1945, in [[San Benito, Texas]]) is an American [[cartoonist]] and [[lawyer]]. His cartoons and comics focus on the law. ==Education== Fincher received his bachelor's degree from the [[University of Texas at Austin]] in 1968, and he was a Distinguished Military Graduate of [[St. Mary's University School of Law]], where he received his [[Juris Doctor|juris doctor]] in 1971. ==Career== He was admitted to the [[State Bar of Texas]] in 1971 and admitted to practice before the Fifth Circuit and the U.S. District Court, [[Southern District of Texas]]. He has practiced law ever since.[http://www.texasbar.com/AM/Template.cfm?Section=Advanced_Search&template=/Customsource/MemberDirectory/MemberDirectoryDetail.cfm&ContactID=167481 State Bar of Texas lawyer listing] In the 1970s, Fincher began publishing his law-related comics and strips. During 1987 he began his long-running Texas-themed political newspaper comic strip, Thadeus & Weez, which ran in 19 Texas newspapers before being retired in 2005.[http://www.thadeusandweez.com Thadeus & Weez] Also in 2005, he won the “Best Web Cartoons” in the "People's Pick" category from About.com for The Illustrated Daily Scribble.[http://dailycartoonist.com/index.php/2005/12/31/aboutcom-award-winners-include-garry-trudeau-tom-tomorrow/ ''The Daily Cartoonist'', "Section Awards," Dec. 31, 2005] Besides Texas newspapers, his editorial cartoons have appeared in the [[Arizona Daily Star]] and the [[Boston Herald]], and his work has been reprinted in textbooks and legal journals.[http://www.baylor.edu/lib/poage/bullock/index.php?id=55849 Baylor University, Collection of Political Materials, cartoon collections] For five years, Fincher's monthly lawyer strip "Fenwilder & Jones" ran in the [[ABA Journal]].[http://legalblogwatch.typepad.com/legal_blog_watch/2006/02/new_cartoon_bla.html Law.com, "New cartoon blawg," February 2006][http://heinonline.org/HOL/LandingPage?collection=journals&handle=hein.journals/abaj65&div=190&id=&page= HeinOnline, ABA Journal, 1979, with Charles Fincher editorial cartoon] Fincher ended his long-running political comic strip, "The Illustrated Daily Scribble," in 2006, because, he was quoted as saying, "The Bush administration is hard to satirize."[http://dailycartoonist.com/index.php/2006/03/23/illustrated-daily-scribble-comes-to-a-close/ ''The Daily Cartoonist'' article, "Illustrated Daily Scribble Comes to a Close," March 23, 2006] Then, a year later, he resumed "Scribble" and launched two new strips, "Scribble-in-Law" and "Scribble Beach".[http://www.allbusiness.com/services/business-services-miscellaneous-business/4694744-1.html ''Editor & Publisher'', "Cartoonist Resumes One 'Scribble' and Starts Two Others," Feb. 6, 2007] His most recent cartoon characters include Bitcher & Prickman, comic law partners.[http://www.greenlaw.com/Christopher-Green-LL.B/some-lawyers-are-stand-up-cartoons Greenlaw.com, "Some lawyers are stand-up cartoons," Aug. 1, 2009] He is also the founder of LawComix, a cartoon site for lawyers. And he is the creator of "Legal Isms," 10 comic strips about lawyers, contracted by [[LexisNexis]].[http://www.theallisonlawfirm.com/HTMLpages/Charles.html Allison law firm biography] In 2008, Fincher was commissioned by the ABA’s Council of Appellate Staff Attorneys (CASA) to paint a fantasy illustration of Constitutional law professor [[Erwin Chemerinsky]] as a shortstop with the [[Chicago Cubs]], the scholar's favorite team. The painting was presented to Chemerinsky at a conference.[http://texaslawyer.typepad.com/texas_lawyer_blog/2008/11/lawyer-paints-portrait-of-con-law-legend.html ''Texas Lawyer'', "Lawyer paints portrait of Con Law legend," November 18, 2008] Fincher practices at The Allison Law Firm, a private firm that specializes in serious injury and wrongful death lawsuits,[http://theallisonlawfirm.com/HTMLpages/Attorneys.html The Allison Law Firm, list of lawyers] in [[South Padre Island, Texas]]. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Portal|Biography}} *[http://www.theillustrateddailyscribble.com/daily.scribble.pages/daily.scribble.archive.index.html "The Daily Scribble" archives] *[http://www.lawcomix.com/cartoonist.html LawComix by Charles Fincher] *[http://offthelaw.blogspot.com/2009/11/sex-at-office.html Off The Law blog by Charles Fincher] *[http://lawyer-slash-artist.blogspot.com/ Lawyer-Slash-Artist blog, original artwork by Charles Fincher] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20110723051940/http://editorialcartoonists.com/cartoonist/index.cfm?count=56 Membership listing, The Association of American Editorial Cartoonists] *[http://www.flakmag.com/comics/ ''Flak Magazine'', Sunday Comics, Aug. 3, 2008] *[http://www.law.com/jsp/lawtechnologynews/PubArticleLTN.jsp?id=1202424168517 Law.com, The Legal Intelligencer: "A Sampling From the Varied Legal Blogosphere" (scroll down), Sept. 2, 2008] {{DEFAULTSORT:Fincher, Charles}} [[Category:American comics artists]] [[Category:American comics writers]] [[Category:American editorial cartoonists]] [[Category:Artists from Texas]] [[Category:American comic strip cartoonists]] [[Category:Comics writers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American webcomic creators]] [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:University of Texas at Austin alumni]] [[Category:St. Mary's University School of Law alumni]] [[Category:Texas lawyers]] [[Category:People from San Benito, Texas]]
